thread.title: What's the rush? N.C. principal charged with passing school bus
thread.title_full: What's the rush? N.C. principal charged with passing school bus | OregonLive.com

author: The Associated Press
title: What's the rush? N.C. principal charged with passing school bus
text:
RALEIGH, N.C. -- A school principal in North Carolina has been charged with passing a stopped school bus, according to a WNCN-TV report .
Bugg Magnet Elementary School principal Johneka Simmons Williams was charged April 27, Wake County School officials confirmed.
An incident report by a Highway Patrol trooper said Williams denied having passed the school bus while the stop arm was out.
The 36-year-old Simmons said in a statement that she takes roadway safety seriously, "particularly when it involves students."
Williams could face a minimum fine of $500 if found guilty.
-- The Associated Press
